Movie: The Fall of the House of Usher
Review: doing a dive into flannigans filmography rn, this one is def more enjoyable and more refined than midnight mass.

best movie of the year and it’s not even a competition.this film can be interpreted in several ways, but to me the by far the most obvious one is the infantilization of women and how it is weaponized on both a micro and macro scale. from how it starts when we are children living at home with our fathers, and later our partners, and when we dare to venture into the world independently we are systemically limited and this…
the whole “you fall victim to your own delusions” thing was hauntingly well done, even going so far as to show how even those who don’t subscribe to the system can and will still fall victim to it.
i genuinely can’t remember the last time i was that engaged with anything i watched, i think i only blinked twice like the whole time
if i saw an exact copy of me dressed in a red jumpsuit i would be like “girl that shit looks terrible on you, get tf outta my house with that business” and then shoot her with a gun
i think i’m just a little late to the party, but this was very overhyped for me. don’t get me wrong, it was a great movie but it felt extremely formulaic and predictable.
this is the best comedy film that’s come out in the last decade.

Movie: The Unbearable Weight of Massive Talent
Review: what a romp. what a fable. definitely a movie, of sorts. don’t think i’ve genuinely laughed like that at a film in a long ass time. FANTASTIC performances from both cage and pascal, idc if the plot was goofy - it was well written and FUN. do you have any idea how may god awful shitty caca terrible poo fart stink movies there are about making movies and how many of them i’ve had to watch???? this was one of…
i have too many thoughts about this right now to get any of them out eloquently but for now i’ll just leave you with i think that this is the best piece of vampire literature of all time

Movie: The Hunger Games: The Ballad of Songbirds & Snakes
Review: to preface, it’s important to note that i have not read the book and have recently consumed a delectable concoction of migraine and sleepy time meds. that being said,
more like five nights at FARTY’S, P.U!!!!!
ladybird did nothing for me but barbie has bewitched me mind, body, and soul. this movie is a work of art and greta gerwig is a genius. i’m gonna go home and cry some more 💖
